acquiring_modules.free_tickets: 10 module tickets are given for free when modules are first unlocked

standard_banner.description: Allows "normal" chances of drawing each epic
standard_banner.special_rule: Modules owned that are 5* Anc are less likely to be pulled

featured_banner.description: Showcases a specific module that will have a subset chance of 50% of epic pulls being that specific module
featured_banner.duration: two week duration followed by a one week break

pull_rates.bad_luck_protection: if you don't get an epic Module for 150 purchases, you're guaranteed an Epic Module
pull_rates.guaranteed_rare: It is guaranteed to have at least 1 rare module in every 10-pull

upgrading_modules.leveling: Modules can be leveled up to improve their main stat using shards and coins
upgrading_modules.max_level: The maximum level of a module is determined by its current rarity
upgrading_modules.merging: By merging modules to higher rarities, you can increase the module to its new max
upgrading_modules.level_preservation: Merging will not reset the current level of the module

shards.shattering_note: after merging, the shards earned from shattering keep the value of all merged modules combined
other_sources: Buying them from the event shop
Natural epics may be shattered once a 5-star Ancestral Mod is formed of the same type

module_reset.method: Modules can be reset by using the "restore" button
module_reset.cost: The button does not cost resources
module_reset.returns: will return all shards spent and all coins spent
module_reset.sub_module_preservation: All sub-module effects will be kept until the module is levelled again, even those that require higher levels, so there is no harm in having several modules with different effects that you swap levels between

shards.scaling: The amount of shards dropped by bosses increase depending on the tier you are running

common_modules.lab_improvement: can be increased with their respective labs

rare_modules.lab_improvement: can be increased with their respective labs

merging_modules.merge_determination: The starting rarity determines how far a module can be merged and what rarity that module can be merged to

merge_capabilities.epic: Can be merged to Ancestral with 5 stars (ancestral is the only rarity with stars)

important_notes: Rare modules will never receive a unique ability when merging even to epic or higher
Rare modules keep their original name. No rare will ever match with an epic that you pulled with gems
Ancestral modules can be upgraded to 5 stars, each star requires an natural epic+ module and increases the main effect

module_stats.main_effect: The primary stat boost (damage, health, coin bonus, or ultimate weapon damage)
module_stats.sub_module_effects: Secondary effects that can be rerolled
module_stats.unique_effects: Special abilities only available on epic+ modules drawn from gems
